relation: Bourbonnais is an extremely safe town. I haven't heard of or had any bad experiences in my four years here.
TONS of ways to get involved.
Olivet is very good at working with you on how to find scholarships to help you out.
Olivet does an incredible job of creating events for students on campus to have fun. Just about every weekend there is a campus event going on that just about the whole student body attends.
The community here is second to none. Best support and friendly atmosphere you can get at a college or university.
Compared to high school, college is extremely tough. You have to learn to prioritize your time better and study a lot more.

There are tons of opportunities to get involved in the Olivet community. Whether it be on campus jobs, student council, ministry, or sports, you can find just about anything that interests you at ONU.
The best possible school for not only getting a strong, academic education but also to learn and grow as a person. I am better prepared for life after college because of Olivet.
pageTitle: Olivet Nazarene University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
textBeforeTable: 07/17/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 14 out of 14 people found this review useful. 1 of 63 Andy from Peoria, IL Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. You could win a free scholarship. textAfterTable: Bang for the buck Olivet is fairly expensive compared to state universities. I am responsible for paying for my education and I think ONU is worth all of the student loans that I will have to pay off. The education is top notch and the professors are very student-centered. The dorms were great to live in my freshman year and I am especially liking living in the apartments my sophomore year. Although we complain about the food a lot, it really is not as bad as it could be. There are a lot of different types of food to chose from in the main dining hall. If all else fails, you are pretty safe getting a burger from the grille and a salad. Am enjoying being here As I take more and more of my major classes, I have become more involved in my classes and they are more enjoyable. It has been great getting to know other students within my major. While I am receiving a great education, I am learning a lot about myself and life while at ONU. There are so many people around campus that I have formed great relationships with and have learned so much from. It is the people that make this school such a great place. Am learning a lot
